summary.long: Lamentations is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text:
How lonely the city sits, which once was full of people!
She, who was great among the nations, is now a widow.
    She, who was a princess among the provinces, now works as a slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At night she weeps bitterly, and her tears linger on her cheek.
    Not one of her lovers is there to comfort her.
    All her friends have betrayed her. They are now her enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judah has gone into exile. She endures affliction and harsh labor.
    She lives among the nations. She finds no rest.
    All her pursuers caught up with her when she was in great distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The roads to Zion are mourning,
    because there are no travelers going to the appointed assemblies.
    All her gates are deserted. Her priests groan.
    Her virgins grieve. Her grief is bitter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her foes have risen to the top. Her enemies prosper.
    Because of her many acts of rebellion, the Lord has brought grief to her.
    Her children have gone into captivity in the presence of the foe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The daughter of Zion has lost all her splendor.
    Her officials have become like deer that find no pasture.
    Powerless, they fled before the pursuer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem remembers the days of her affliction and her homeless wandering.
    She remembers all her precious things which were hers from long ago.
    When her people fell under the hand of the foe, there was no one to help her.
    Foes saw her and laughed at the end she has come to.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem has sinned terribly, so she is unclean.
    All who once honored her now despise her, because they have seen her nakedness.
    She can only sigh and turn away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her flow of blood stains her skirt. She did not consider the outcome of her sin.
    Her collapse was astonishing. There was no one to comfort her.
    Look, Lord, at my affliction, for the enemy has done awful things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The foe has laid hands on all her precious things.
    She has even seen nations enter her sanctuary,
    nations about whom you commanded, “They shall not enter your assembly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All her people are sighing as they search for bread.
    They traded their precious things for food in order to stay alive.
    Look, Lord, and see that I have become despised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But nothing like this is happening to you, all you who pass me by.
    Look and see if there is any pain like my pain, which was dealt out to me,
    which the Lord caused me to suffer on the day of his burning anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From on high he sent fire into my bones and overpowered me.
    He spread a net for my feet. He turned me back.
    He made me desolate. I was sick all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The yoke of my sinful rebellion is fastened to my neck.
    My sins are bound together by his hand.
    They have risen up as high as my neck. He has weakened my strength.
    The Lord has given me into the hands of people I cannot resist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has tossed aside all the strong men in my midst.
    He called an assembly against me to break my best young men.
    The Lord has trampled the virgin daughter of Judah in a winepress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of these things, I am weeping. My eye, my eye flows with water,
    because the comforter, the one who restores my soul, is far away from me.
    My children have become desolate, because the enemy has prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zion spreads out her hands, but there is no one to comfort her.
    The Lord has commanded those who surround Jacob to be his foes.
    Among them, Jerusalem has become an unclean thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is righteous. I am the one who rebelled against the word from his mouth.
    Please listen, all you peoples, and see my pain.
    My virgins and my best young men have gone into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I called to my lovers, but they deceived me.
    My priests and my elders perished in the city,
    as they sought food for themselves to restore their lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See, Lord, I am in distress. My emotions are in turmoil.
    My heart turns over inside me, because I have been very rebellious.
    Outside, the sword takes away my children.
    Inside, there is death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People have heard that I am groaning. There is no one who comforts me.
    All my enemies have heard about my misery, and they rejoiced that you did this.
    Bring on the day that you have announced, so that they may become like me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May all their wickedness come before you. Deal harshly with them,
    just as you dealt harshly with me because of all my rebellion.
    Yes, my groans are many, and my heart is sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How the Lord, in his anger, has covered the daughter of Zion with a dark cloud!
    He threw down the beauty of Israel from heaven to earth.
    He did not remember his footstool in the day of his anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord swallowed up and did not spare the pastures of Jacob.
    In his fury he tore down the fortifications of the daughter of Judah.
    He brought them down to the ground. He brought dishonor to the kingdom and its officials.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He completely chopped off the horn of Israel in burning anger.
    He withdrew his right hand in the presence of the enemy.
    He burned in Jacob like a flaming fire, which consumed all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He bent his bow like an enemy. His right hand was ready like a foe,
    and he killed everyone who was precious in his eyes.
    On the tent of the daughter of Zion, he poured out his wrath like fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord was like an enemy. He swallowed up Israel.
    He swallowed up all her citadels. He left her fortresses in ruins.
    He increased mourning and lamenting for the daughter of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He dealt violently with his shelter like a shed in a garden. He ruined his meeting place.
    The Lord has caused the appointed assembly and the Sabbath to be forgotten in Zion.
    In his indignation and anger he showed contempt for king and priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord rejected his altar. He abandoned his holy place.
    He delivered her walls and palaces into the hand of the enemy.
    They gave a shout in the House of the Lord,
    like that on the day of an appointed assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord had in mind to ruin the wall of the daughter of Zion.
    He stretched out a measuring line. He did not restrain his hand from swallowing her up.
    He made its rampart and wall mourn. Together they became weak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her gates have sunk down to the ground. He destroyed and shattered her bars.
    Her king and her officials are exiled among the nations. There is no law.
    Even her prophets have not received a vision from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The elders of the daughter of Zion sit on the ground and are silent.
    They throw dust on their heads and put on sackcloth.
    The virgins of Jerusalem bow their heads to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes are worn out with tears. I am troubled in my heart.
    I am emotionally drained over the breaking of the daughter of my people,
    while children and infants grow weak in the public squares of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
What testimony can I give on your behalf?
    What can I compare to you, daughter of Jerusalem?
    What can I place next to you, so that I may comfort you, virgin daughter of Zion?
    Your wound is as wide as the sea. Who can heal you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your prophets saw visions for you, but they were empty and worthless.
    They did not reveal your guilt, in order to turn away your captivity.
    They saw oracles for you that were empty and misleading.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who passed by clapped their hands over you.
    They hissed and shook their head over the daughter of Jerusalem:
    “Is this the city that was said to be the perfection of beauty,
    the joy of the whole earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your enemies opened their mouth against you.
    They hissed and gnashed their teeth. They said, “We swallowed her up.
    Yes, this is the day we were waiting for. We found it. We saw it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has done what he planned. He carried out his word,
    which he commanded long ago. He tore down and did not spare.
    He let the enemy rejoice over you. He raised up the horn of your foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their heart cried out to the Lord.
    O wall of the daughter of Zion,
    let your tears flow like a torrent, day and night.
    Do not let yourself become numb. Do not let your eye stop crying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Get up! Shout out during the night, as the night watches begin!
    Pour out your heart like water before the Lord’s face.
    Lift up your hands to him to pray for the life of your children,
    who are faint with hunger at every street corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, Lord, and see! With whom have you dealt so harshly?
    Should women eat the children they produced,
    the children they played with on their knee?
    Should priest and prophet be killed in the Lord’s holy place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the streets young and old lie dead on the ground.
    My virgins and my best young men have fallen by the sword.
    You killed them on the day of your anger. You slaughtered and did not spare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As you do on a day of assembly, you summoned from every side the things I dread.
    On the day of the Lord’s anger, there was no one who escaped or survived.
    The enemy destroyed the children I played with on my knee and raised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the man who has experienced affliction under the rod of his fury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He drove me off and brought me into darkness instead of light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See how he turns against me. He turns his hand against me all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wore out my flesh and my skin. He shattered my bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He built siege works against me. He surrounded me with bitterness
    and hardship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made me dwell in dark places, like people who died long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He walled me in, so I cannot leave. He made my chains heavy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even when I call and cry out, he shuts out my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has blocked my way with a stone wall. He has made my paths crooked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is about to ambush me like a bear, like a lion lying in wait.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He diverted me off my path and tore me to pieces. He made
    me desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He bent his bow and set me up as a target for the arrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shot the arrows from his quiver into my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was a laughingstock to all my people, the target of their song
    all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has made me eat bitter food and drink my fill of wormwood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He broke my teeth with gravel. He pushed me down into the ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You deprived my soul of peace. I have forgotten what well-being is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, “My endurance has vanished, along with my hope from
    the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember my affliction and my homeless wandering,
    the wormwood and bitterness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My soul always remembers, and it has sunk within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, I keep this in my heart. This is the reason I have hope:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the mercies of the Lord we are not consumed, for his compassions do not fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are new every morning. Great is your faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My soul says, “The Lord is my portion. Therefore, I will hope in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is good to those who wait for him, to the soul who seeks him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is good to hope quietly for the salvation of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is good for a man that he bears a yoke early in his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him sit alone and be silent, because the Lord has laid this upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him stick his face in the dust. Perhaps there still is hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him turn his cheek toward the one who strikes him. Let him be filled with disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord will not push us away forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even though he brings grief, he will show compassion on the basis of his great mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Certainly it is not what his heart desires when he causes affliction,
    when he brings grief to the children of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To crush all the land’s prisoners under his feet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to deny a man’s right before the face of the Most High,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to undermine a man in his legal dispute—
    the Lord does not look with favor on these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can speak something and have it happen, unless the Lord commands it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t the bad things and the good both come from the mouth of the Most High?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can any living man complain?
    How can someone complain about the consequences of his sins?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us explore and examine our ways, and let us return to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us lift up our hearts and hands to God in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We were disobedient and rebelled, so you did not forgive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You covered yourself with anger and pursued us. You killed and did not spare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You covered yourself with a cloud, so that no prayer passes through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You make us like scraps and garbage among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All our enemies opened their mouth against us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Panic and the pit were ours, devastation and destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Streams of water run down from my eyes,
    because of the breaking of the daughter of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My eye pours without stopping. It will not cease,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until the Lord looks down so that he sees from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I see makes my soul ache for all the daughters of my city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no reason, my enemies hunted me like a bird.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ended my life in the pit and threw stones at me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Water flowed above my head, and I said, “I am cut off!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I called on your name, Lord, from the deepest pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You heard my voice: “Do not hide your ear from my cry for relief!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The day I called to you, you came near and said, “Do not fear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, you pleaded my soul’s case. You redeemed my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, you saw how I was wronged. Judge my case.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You saw all their vengeance, all their plans against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You heard their scorn, Lord, all their plans against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You heard the lips of those who rise up against me
    and their plots against me all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Watch them when they sit down and when they get up.
    I am the target of their mocking song.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will pay them back, Lord, according to what their hands have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will give them a stubborn heart. Your curse is on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will pursue them in anger
    and destroy them from under the heavens of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How dull the gold has become! How the fine gold has lost its shimmer!
Sacred stones are poured out at the corner of every street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The precious sons of Zion, who were worth their weight in gold,
    now are treated like clay jars, the work of a potter’s hands!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even jackals offer a breast and nurse their young,
    but the daughter of my people has become cruel, like an ostrich in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The baby’s tongue sticks to the roof of its mouth because of thirst.
    Children ask for bread, but no one shares with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who ate delicacies have become desolate in the streets.
    Those who were dressed in scarlet have embraced piles of trash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The guilt of the daughter of my people was greater than the sin of Sodom,
    which was overthrown in a moment, though no hands turned against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her consecrated ones were brighter than snow. They were whiter than milk.
    Their bones were redder than rubies; their facets shined like sapphires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now their faces have become the darkest black. They cannot be recognized in the streets.
    Their skin has shriveled on their bones. It is as dry as a stick of wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those cut down by the sword are better off than those cut down by hunger,
    those who waste away, pierced with pain, with no crops to eat from the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hands of compassionate women boiled their children.
    Their children became their food when the daughter of my people was broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord carried out his wrath. He poured out his burning anger.
    He kindled a fire in Zion, and it consumed her foundations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of the earth and the world’s inhabitants never believed
    that foe and enemy would enter the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The reason this happened was the sin of her prophets and the guilt of her priests,
    who shed the blood of the righteous in her midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those blind men staggered in the streets. They were defiled with blood,
    so people could not touch their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go away! Unclean!” people shouted to them. “Go away! Go away! Do not touch us!”
    When they fled, when they staggered, people among the nations said,
    “They may not stay here anymore.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The face of the Lord scattered them. He has no regard for them anymore.
    Priests were shown no consideration. Elders were shown no favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our eyes are still worn out, looking in vain for our help.
    In our watchtowers we watched for a nation that could not save us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They hunted our steps, preventing us from going into the public squares of our city.
    Our end has drawn near. Our days are finished, for our end has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our pursuers were faster than eagles in the sky.
    On the mountains they were in hot pursuit of us. In the wilderness they waited to ambush us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The life breath for our nostrils, the anointed of the Lord, was caught in their pits.
    We had said of him, “In his shadow we will live among the nations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice and be glad, daughter of Edom, who dwells in the land of Uz.
    A cup will also come to you. You will become drunk and naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The punishment for your guilt is finished, daughter of Zion. He will not send you into exile again.
    Daughter of Edom, he punishes your guilt. He reveals your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember, Lord, what happened to us. Look and see our disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers, our houses to foreigners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have become orphans without a father. Our mothers are widows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We pay money to drink our own water. We must buy firewood for a price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our pursuers are at our throat. We are exhausted. We are given no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have made a deal with Egypt and Assyria to have enough bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our fathers sinned. They are no more, and we have borne their guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slaves rule over us. No one rescues us from their hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We get bread at the risk of our life because of the sword in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our skin is as hot as an oven because of fever from hunger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Women in Zion have been violated, virgins in the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Officials have been hung up by their hands. The dignity of elders has not been respected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The best young men must grind grain, and boys stumble under loads of wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elders are no longer seated in the city gate. The best young men no longer play music.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The joy of our hearts has ceased. Our dancing has turned into mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crown has fallen off our head. Woe to us, because we have sinned!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our heart is sick over this. Over these things our eyes have grown dim—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: over Mount Zion, which is devastated, so that jackals prowl on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, Lord, remain forever. Your throne remains for generation after generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you forget us completely? Why do you abandon us for so long?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, turn us back to you, and we will return. Renew our days like long ago,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unless you have completely rejected us and you will be angry at us without limit.
verses.speaker: Narrator
